{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Linksys |model=WRT400N |revision=v1 |serialnum_prefix=MUJ0 |upc=745883587094 |asin=B001SEL36M |est_release_date= |fcc_date=01/09/2009 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Gemtek |manuf_model=WRTA-244N |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=Q87-WRT400N |ic_id=3839A-WRT400N |pcb_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR7161;AR7161-BC1A, P1R522.00C2, 1003, CHINA; |cpu1_cspeed=680 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Winbond |fla1_model=W25X64VFIG |ram1=32 |ram1_brand=Winbond |ram1_model=W9425G6EH-5 |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR9223;AR9223-AC1A, N1P585.00B, 0953, TAIWAN; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi2_chip1_model=AR9220;AR9220-AC1A, N1P624.00C, 1003, CHINA; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Atheros |sw_model=AR8216;AR8216-BH1A, D00924B4, 0953, TAIWAN; |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=100M |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Microsemi;LX5511;MSC, 5511, 004F;2; ,,, 4.9 to 5.9GHz Power Amplifier IC;Microsemi;LX5530;MSC, 5530, 002C;2;InGaP/GaAs HBT;3 mm x 3 mm; ,,, 3A, 18V, 340KHz Synchronous Rectified Step-Down Converter;MPS;MP1484;MP1484EN, 97721307, MPS042;1;SOIC8N; |flags= |tp_firmware=DD-WRT, OpenWrt, |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid=linksys,linksys_media |default_ssid_regex=^linksys$,,,^linksys_media$ |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user= |default_pass=admin |oui=00:25:9C,68:7F:74 |oui_eth=00:25:9C,68:7F:74 }} {{TagLine|Simultaneous Dual-Band Wireless-N Router}} :{{SupportPage|vendor=Linksys|model=WRT400N}} *OEM: [[Gemtek]] WRTA-244N (WRTA-244N_V02) The power adapter included with the device is a :'''Leader Electronics''' MU18-D120150-A1 (12V, 1.5A). ==Links of Interest== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Linksys_WRT400N On the DD-WRT wiki] *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/inbox/linksys/wrt400n On the OpenWrt wiki] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linksys_routers Listed on the 'Linksys routers' page on Wikipedia] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=83533 Bricked a Cisco/Linksys WRT400N... Help?] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=50794 DD-WRT on WRT400N?] @ [[WikiDevi:DD-WRT|DD-WRT]] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=66602 Linksys WRT400N Support] @ [[WikiDevi:DD-WRT|DD-WRT]] *[[dd-wrt-wiki:Wireless-N Throughput Testing|Wireless-N Throughput Testing]] @ [[WikiDevi:DD-WRT|DD-WRT]] *[http://www.gargoyle-router.com/phpbb/viewtopic.php?f=7&t=980 About button handler] @ Gargoyle ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing DD-WRT=== {{DDWRTNotice|microno}} [[dd-wrt-wiki:Linksys WRT400N|Linksys WRT400N]] :DD-WRT nvram=64 Files needed: * (14289) [ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/BrainSlayer-V24-preSP2/04-16-10-r14289/linksys_wrt400n/linksys-to-ddwrt-firmware.bin linksys-to-ddwrt-firmware.bin] - For first time flashing only * (14289) [ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/BrainSlayer-V24-preSP2/04-16-10-r14289/linksys_wrt400n/wrt400n-firmware.bin wrt400n-firmware.bin] # Do a [[WikiDevi.Wi-Cat.RU:DD-WRT/Hard reset or 30/30/30|Hard reset or 30/30/30]] on the router # Set a static IP on your computer to 192.168.1.7. Subnet mask should be 255.255.255.0. # Connect the lan cable from your computer to a LAN port of your router. Make sure your router is plugged in. Nothing should be connected to your computer or the router except the lan cable between them. Turn your firewall and any wireless computer connections OFF. # Power cycle the router (uplug the power from the router for 30 seconds and then plug it back in) # Open your browser to 192.168.1.1 by putting that in the browser address window of your browser. You should open the linksys webgui and NOT a page that says Management Mode. If you see management mode, power cycle the router again. # Leave the username blank and enter "admin" as the password # Go to administration and firmware upgrade # Navigate to the folder that you are using, and select [ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/BrainSlayer-V24-preSP2/04-16-10-r14289/linksys_wrt400n/linksys-to-ddwrt-firmware.bin linksys-to-ddwrt-firmware.bin] # Hit upgrade # When you get a success, wait FIVE FULL minutes. # If you don't get success, repeat from steps 6 up to this one. If you still don't get success, clear your browser cache. Try using a different browser as well, to navigate to 192.168.1.1. # When you can access the dd-wrt webgui using a browser at 192.168.1.1, power cycle the router. # When you can again access the dd-wrt webgui using a browser at 192.168.1.1, do another [[WikiDevi.Wi-Cat.RU:DD-WRT/Hard reset or 30/30/30|Hard reset or 30/30/30]] on the router. # Go to administration and firmware upgrade # Navigate to the folder that you are using, and select [ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/BrainSlayer-V24-preSP2/04-16-10-r14289/linksys_wrt400n/wrt400n-firmware.bin wrt400n-firmware.bin] # Hit upgrade # When you get a success, wait FIVE FULL minutes. # At this point you can choose to put a different build on, depending on what you needs are. # Reset your computer ethernet connection to auto IP and auto DNS ===Flashing OpenWRT=== *[[openwrtwiki:inbox/linksys/wrt400n|Linksys WRT400N]] ===Flashing Gargoyle=== *[http://www.gargoyle-router.com/phpbb/viewtopic.php?f=5&t=1270 Linksys WRT400N] ==Upgrading== {{Upgrade dd-wrt}} ==Reverting== ===Reverting to OEM Firmware from DD-WRT=== ==== TFTP Revert ==== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=73823 Linksys WRT400N Revert to Linksys firmware] [[WikiDevi:DD-WRT/TFTP flash|TFTP flash]] revert reported working by LOM ====GUI Revert==== Special thx to LOM, who created the file. # Restore factory defaults via dd-wrt GUI. # Set static IP address to 192.168.1.10 # Goto firmware upgrade, click browse, find the revert file [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/download.php?id=14927&sid=b38b6181748554e0622c6ac0182d9cfd WRT400N_webrevert.bin], click upgrade. # IMPORTANT: wait 5 minutes # Enter 192.168.1.1 in the web browser. # At the prompt, leave the username blank and enter "admin" w/o the quotes as the password. # Don't forget to set your IP back to Obtain an IP address automatically. ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===JTAG=== ====JTAG Pinouts==== 
 nTRST   1o o2	 GND
   TDI   3o o4	 GND
   TDO   5o o6	 GND
   TMS   7o o8	 GND
   TCK   9o o10	 GND
 nSRST  11o o12  N/C
   N/C  13o o14  N/C
===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== 
 GND  4 o
  TX  3 o
  RX  2 o
 VCC  1 o
{{Serial TTL Setup WinXP |serialport = |serial_port_num = |serial_speed = |serial_data_bits = |serial_parity = |serial_stop_bits = |serial_flow_cntl = }} ====DD-WRT Serial Recovery==== To recover from a bad flash and get back to DD-WRT..... Download [ftp://ftp.darkhaven.org/routers/Linksys%20WRT400N/wrt400n-openwrt-to-dd-wrt.bin openwrt-to-dd-wrt.bin], Don't worry about the name, it will get you back to DD-WRT. Download [http://tftpd32.jounin.net/ TFTP32] Configure PC to 192.168.1.88 Install TFTP32 Set it up as server, browse to where the recovery file is. Then in telnet(putty or hyper terminal) enter tftpboot 0x80010000 openwrt-to-dd-wrt.bin and if you get a successful tftp transfer then: erase 0xbf040000 +0x600000 cp.b 0x80010000 0xbf040000 0x600000 Then enter boot ==USB Info== No USB ==Pictures==

[[Has images::fcc| ]][[Has images::retail| ]][[Has images::internal| ]][[Has images::external| ]] ==Notes== ===DD-WRT Notes=== ====Known DD-WRT Issues==== '''Running dd-wrt 14144''' # Still has constantly blinking wireless LED Ticket #1420 # Still has LAN MAC sudo matching ath1's MAC Ticket #1435 # Security LED still doesn't come on when security is set Ticket #1434 # Site Survey for ath0 shows double and triple the SSID's for the same MAC address Ticket #1431 # TX Power setting have no affect Ticket #1433 # 5 {{abbr|GHz|gigahertz}} rate always says auto rather then actually speed Ticket #1436 # Site Survey now works for ath1 (5 {{abbr|GHz|gigahertz}}) '''Running dd-wrt 14039''' Lan Speed Test Results (if setting is not listed it is default)
5 {{abbr|GHz|gigahertz}} - ath1
Wireless Network Mode - N-Only (5 {{abbr|GHz|gigahertz}})
Channel Width - Turbo (40 {{abbr|MHz|megahertz}})
Control Channel - upper
Laptop w/ Linksys WPC600N 
 Writing---------------Reading
 Packet Length:-------104,857,600------104,857,600
 Time to complete:----17.3910000-------29.7180000
 Bytes Per Second:----6,029,418--------3,528,420
 Bits Per Seecond:----48,235,344-------28,227,360
 Mbps:----------------46.0008087-------26.9197083
Problems Seen thus far on dd-wrt... # MAC address on mine are screwed up like my wrt600n. wl1 and LAN MAC are the same. They weren't in the Linksys firmware. # The wireless led on solid # Posting across 2.4 {{abbr|GHz|gigahertz}} Client Bridge right now. Bridged to wrt600n. # 5 {{abbr|GHz|gigahertz}} Client Bridge very unstable, won't maintain connection with wrt600n. Keeps changing the channel when reconnecting. Maybe result of reconnection. # Upgrade went smooth. Haven't tested client connections to the wrt400n. # Wireless Security LED doesn't come on when security is set. # 5 {{abbr|GHz|gigahertz}} is lacking channels when set as AP ===Collected Info=== {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed wikitable" |- !
